name: Hotel Ibis Xi'an

reviews.text: Ibis is a basic hotel. If all you need is a place to stay that's clean, it's fine. If you are a tourist who does not speak Mandarin, you aren't going to get much help here. The room is tiny. We opted for a family room thinking that two beds would be useful. The second bed is really for a child although it's standard length. The mattress was actually softer than their original bedding so we kept it. Even though we were on a non-smoking floor, the smell of smoke wafted in. What prompted us to move though was the construction noise outside and the dust generated. Breakfast was cheap (about $4 USD) but didn't look edible. There are restaurants in the same block. Before we discovered that, we walked the other way to a main street and found more local restaurants. It seemed like primarily a residential area. The hotel is close to the wall.
reviews.title: Value for the price but if you can afford more, go elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights in January 2013. Overall, we were satisfied with our stay - the rooms were tidy, clean (although a bit small) and we didn't have any problems. Overall, if you're simply looking for somewhere to sleep, it's a good choice.
reviews.title: Value for Money

reviews.text: Hotel location is decent - about a 20 minute walk from the Bell Tower, so it is manageable if you want to walk from where the Xi'an Airport Bus drops you off. There are also bus stops right outside the hotel which can take you to the railway station and wherever else you want to go. The hotel is also very close to the city wall. However, as others have mentioned, it is not particularly close to any decent restaurants etc.
reviews.title: Good location, but small rooms

reviews.text: Check-in staff were a bit hit and miss in terms of helpfulness. However, they were always polite and seemed to be trying their best. That said, we didn't have much to do with them beyond check-in, check-out and trying to figure out which bus to take to the station.
reviews.title: Budget

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stay here twice. It's a good location within easy walking distance of the City Wall. Once you're on the City Wall, you can go anywhere by foot. So you should consider this hotel on your first trip if you do't have much time to explore. But it is removed from any type of vibrant restaurant/shopping area. Recently, Xian has had a large increase in hotels near such more exciting areas, and we'll probably not stay in the Ibis in the future. (Try something on Dong Dajie [East Avenue]).
reviews.title: "Good rooms, terrible service"

reviews.text: Hotel is clean compare to the hotel we have stay in shanghai and both are in the same price range. breakfast is ok. You can take the bus from the train station going to this hotel. Frontdesk did give instructions on how to take bus going to the ancient wall but its better to just take the cab. Best if you do all your research on which place you want to visit so you know all your options. Theres wifi in the common area but no signal in our room. There's a "restaurant" (for lack of a better term) on the other side of the hotel you just have to cross the road and the food there is great. They cannot speak and understand english so we just pointed the food we want. but the owner is nice or she just smile a lot.
reviews.title: Clean budget hotel

reviews.text: Good hotel, cheap, clean but don't wait to find the same quality as Ibis in France for example.
reviews.title: Clean, but not have exactky the same standard as European Ibis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But still I think it's a good hotel for foreigner, so I could advice it for people with a low budget they will find a good price.
reviews.title: Typical Ibis- Great value, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at the IBIS in Xi'an and would recommend it to anyone locating for a decent budget hotel (3 nights cost us $80 total)
reviews.title: Good value with some issues

reviews.text: The room is small with no-frills but was clean, didn't smell of cigarette smoke and was fairly quiet.
reviews.title: Good choise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were initially taken aback by its location and facade; its is located among a roll of old shop houses. After checking in and settling in then we discovered it is a gem. It is an absolutely no frill but very clean hotel. Considering that there is so much to see in Xian and you spend little time in your room, this is perfect. The reception staff is a crew of new generation and very helpful young Chinese. As commented by by previous hotel guests, the staff was great in guiding us to everywhere on public transport. It was near impossible to try to catch a cab in Xian so we used the bus with the staff's help. There is a bus stop and a police post (2 policemen sitting inside a wooden hut) right outside the hotel. Therefore it is very convenient and safe. It is also a few minutes walk to the South Gate of the City Wall, an attraction in Xian. Beware of the Szechuan restaurant near the hotel; the restaurant is a nice looking place with rolls of chinese lanterns in the next block on the right side if you are leaving the hotel. They got us to order a fresh fish which they scooped out of their tank and then served us a frozen fish. The waitress quickly retrieved the fish when we showed her the frozen part of the fish sitting on our plate of supposedly fresh fish. The hotel is away from the vicinity of the Bell/Drum Towers and Muslim Street. It is a bus ride away of about 7 stops. There is nothing much there; both the towers are under renovation so can't see much and the Muslim Street has little to offer. The street parallel to the Muslim Street is lined with vendors selling fakes and a tourist rip-off.
reviews.title: A Gem

reviews.text: Price is fair,and rooms are very clean, so staff was helpful, give information about number of bus around Xian. bed is comfort, but the pillow was so flat not good ....anyway ,we like this location nearly railway station.
reviews.title: Ibis Hotel Xian

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At around $22 AUD a night we weren't expecting too much, but what we got was pretty great. Free internet; clean well maintained rooms and fairly polite staff. If you need English, the staff are all pretty good and are able to book taxis to the airport for 150 kuai.
reviews.title: Great Budget Hotel

reviews.text: The beds are hard but that is what is expected across the board in any hotel in China.
reviews.title: Excellent staff at great budget hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really close to the city wall, only a 2 minute walk to your left as you are leaving the hotel.
reviews.title: Good, clean and great location

reviews.text: Very disappointing ! Tried Ibis in Sidney ( Darling Harbour ) once, and it was reasonable !
reviews.title: Really basic - basic hotel !!!

reviews.text: This one, it,s a joke - 1 pillow p/person lol ! Ask for 1 more and answer - no extra pillows available ! Made a fuss and managed to get some, after few hours !!
reviews.title: Clean and Good

reviews.text: Paper tea cups, mobile type bathrooms, bed very hard and mini bed side table ! Also forget about to ask to call taxi to airport or train station ! - They can not do it - service no available !!!
reviews.title: Good location, efficient staff

reviews.text: Give it a miss - find another hotel !
reviews.title: Great value for accomodation in Xi'an

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good european standard. It was clean and the staff accessible. We had some issues with the wifi but it was quickly solved by the reception. It is just beside a clean massage center where we could have a feet and head massage after the long day of walk.
reviews.title: Helpful staff

description: Located in the heart of the city, Hotel Ibis Xian is a relaxing and affordable way to enjoy the Shaanxi province. Home to the Terracotta Warriors of the Qin Emperor, Shaanxi Provincial History Museum, and the Big Wild Goose Pagoda, Xian is your gateway to exploring the attractions of the region. Ideal for leisure and corporate guests, the 220 room hotel combines comfort with convenience. Boasting a 24hr cafe, a meeting room and onsite parking, the hotel is just minutes from the Xian Railway Station.
